Posts.Content: Jan 15, 2009 07:59AM SusanZ1961 wrote: Hi, Anyone in the B-40 Study?  I have been in the study since 8/7/08.  I have completed the chemo/Bevacizumab my surgery is set for 1/28/09  I will have a bilateral mastectomy with expanders.  Just found out that I also  need radiation, bummer!    So now adding the rads to the bevacizumab I will not be able  to fill the expanders until end of the summer and I will not have finished with ps unitl well into the fall/winter of 2009.   I am so depressed.  How long will cancer rule my life????
Posts.Title: January Mastectomy crusader1 bettelou68

Posts.Content: Jan 22, 2009 02:36PM SusanZ1961 wrote: I am having a bilateral mastectomy with expanders on Wed. 1/28/09.  This is the best sight for advice and support. Thanks.  I am most concerned about pain and the drains.  I have never spent the night in a hospital except for the birth of two children. My surgeron says I will stay two nights.   I am in a new city and not familiar with the hospital.
Posts.Title: January Mastectomy crusader1 bettelou68

Posts.Content: May 7, 2009 12:16PM SusanZ1961 wrote: ameron, I had lots of other symptoms for over a year.  I actually went to my primary care doc with complaints of fatigue, joint pain, and trouble sleeping.  She did a full work up and thought I was starting into menopause, she  gave me sleeping pills and pain killers.  That was 8/07.  Starting having pain in my left breast in 5/08 and in 07/08 I called my gynecologist and she order a mamo.  On July 11, 2008 I found I had breast cancer.  two tumors in left breast.  I think when most women look back the can see changes on how they feel, but don't know why. I have completed most of treatment and surgeries.  I am starting to feel really good again. Good Luck!
Posts.Title: OTHER SYMPTOMS??? ameron zuzeee
